FacilityName: Morrow County Grain Growers, Inc., Ione

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan Executive Summary

Morrow County Grain Growers Inc

Ione, Oregon



1.    Stationary Source and Regulated Substances

Our facility's primary activities include support services for crop production. The Risk Management Program covers our Anhydrous Ammonia storage and transfer system. Our RMP process consists of one 18,000 gallon ASME bulk storage tank and three 2,500 gallon DOT cargo tank trucks.  We also have twelve 1,000 gallon applicator tanks and five 1,000 gallon nurse tanks. Applicator and nurse tanks are stored at the facility when not in use. Minimal product is stored in these tanks when at our facility. The average maximum amount stored at our facility is 25,097 gallons (137,784 lbs) including the applicator and nurse tanks. The largest single storage container at our facility is the 18,000 gallon bulk storage tank which holds 15,300 gallons (83,948 lbs) when filled to its maximum capacity of 85%.



2.    Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response

Morrow County Grain Growers is committed to the safety of our employees, the public and the environment. This commitment is an inherent part of our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers process areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance and employee training at our facilities. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances. We coordinate our response efforts with the Morrow County LEPC and the Ione Fire Department.



3.    Accidental Release Prevention program

Our facility has taken the necessary steps to comply with the requirements set forth in 40 CFR, Part 68. The following sections briefly describe the elements of our accidental release prevention program.



a.    Process Safety Information

Morrow County Grain Growers maintains a detailed record of safety information describing the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with the processes at our

facility.



b.    Process Hazard Analysis

We conduct periodic reviews to ensure the hazards associated with our processes are identified and controlled effectively. Findings from our Hazard Analysis reviews are addressed in a timely manner.



c.    Operating Procedures

We maintain written operating procedures to ensure that activities within our covered processes are conducted safely. Operating procedures are reviewed periodically and updated as needed.



d.    Training

Morrow County Grain Growers uses a comprehensive training program to ensure employees involved in our processes are competent in the operation and maintenance of our facilities. Employees receive annual training on the storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia. Employees also receive training if any updates or modifications are made to our facility that would affect operations or maintenance.



e.    Mechanical Integrity

Documented monthly facility inspections are conducted by trained and qualified employees. These inspections include the storage containers and all process equipment. Maintenance is performed as needed and documented. 



f.    Program Compliance Audits

Periodic compliance audits are performed to ensure our program meets the requirements of 40 CFR, Part 68. Audits include all components of our Risk Management Program. Morrow County Grain Growers contracts with a third-party safety consultant to perform annual safety inspections and program compliance audits.



4.    Five-year Accident History

Due to our stringent release prevention policies, no accidental releases have occurred in the last five years.



5.    Emergency Response Plan

Morrow County Grain Growers maintains a written Emergency Action Plan for the Ione facility. The plan addresses emergency response issues including first aid, medical treatment and evacuation procedures. Information and procedures for contacting local response agencies (fire department, LEPC) are included in this plan.



6.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Morr
ow County Grain Growers is implementing a Process Safety Management program for our Anhydrous Ammonia process. The PSM program will enhance the current Risk Management Program.
